titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University. MS Or 37: Badāʼiʻ al-funūn.

licence.#text: These images and the content of Rare Book and Manuscript Library MS Or 37: Badāʼiʻ al-funūn. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, Columbia University, Rare Book & Manuscript Library has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about Rare Book and Manuscript Library MS Or 37: Badāʼiʻ al-funūn.. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

msContents.summary: On accounting for merchants, including calculating shorthands to make accounting easier (abjad numbers), which the author calls ʻilm al-siyāq.

supportDesc.extent: 56 foliated leaves : 236 x 140 (190 x 100) mm, bound to 245 x 145 mm

layoutDesc.layout: 14-15 long lines with alpha-numerical calculations and marginalia; catchwords on versos, lower left.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in nastaʻliq in black ink; pointed, unvocalized.

binding.p: Islamic binding. Brown leather frame binding with blind tooling, bright blue paper sides. Outer corners of leather frames create a triangular shape. Endbands with chevron-pattern secondary sewing.

provenance: Formerly owned by Muḥammad ʻAlī Khān, dated A.H. 1231? (1816) (owner's stamp on f. 1r).
